author: James R. Hagerty
title: Helmut Maucher Spurred Nestlé With Acquisitions and War on Bureaucracy
text:
Helmut Maucher had a message for employees of Nestlé SA when he became chief executive of the Swiss food company in 1981: Down with bureaucracy. “Let’s have more pepper and less paper,” he said.
For 16 years, the German-born executive combined his war on paper shuffling with ambitious acquisitions to spur growth.
Mr. Maucher, pronounced MAO-ker,...
